title: Multiple Stored XSS on Sanbox.veris.in through Veris Frontdesk Android App
vulnerability_information: Hello Team, I have found multiple cross site scripting vulnerabilities on sanbox.veris.in due to the malicious input injected through veris frontdesk android app. Vulnerable App : Veris Frontdesk Android App Vulnerable Input Fields: 1) Who do you wish to meet? 2) Additional Information Payload used: and Reflects where: https://sandbox.veris.in/portal/visitor-log/ Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open Veris Front Desk App. 2. Go to Check In. 3. Enter the required details like first name, last name and phone number. 4. Proceed to Next. 5. Inject the above mentioned payload in vulnerable input fields. 6. Submit it and Check In. 7. Login to your account on sandbox.veris.in 8. Go to https://sandbox.veris.in/portal/visitor-log/ 9. Tadaa! XSS Triggers. Proof of Concept: Please find the attached screenshots. Do evaluate it and inform me accordingly. Best Regards, Hely H. Shah

activities.message: @itly The input Fields screenshot is the wrong one you attested I guess. Please attach a screenshot of the Frontdesk App
@veris-nayan - Yeah, by mistake. Please find the correct one attached.

Try to check out using the phone number or email id input in previous field.
The data you input there should be visible. Attach a screenshot of that screen.
@veris-nayan - Already tried! Actually, I am not able to intercept the check in request and change the values. App restricts me to enter scripts in those fields.

No I mean to say, if you have sent a script as an input in Additional Information field, when you click on the Check Out button from the dashboard and type the phone number you used to check in, you can find this entry. Send me a screenshot of that screen which would show a script in front of Additional Information.
@veris-nayan - I am exactly not understanding what you want. But I am attaching one screenshot where both entries of a user are there. Check in and check out both. Do you wanted this?
When you tried to check out from the frontdesk app, what did you see?
@veris-nayan - If I input mobile number to checkout, I am getting an error message saying "No activity found". If I have 5 digit code and I use it to checkout, I am able to check out successfully.
Right, so Give me the screenshot of that screen where you press the tap to check out button and there you would see Additional Information along with your check in time.

@veris-nayan - Please find it attached. But this screen I found when I re-scaned the already checked-in user. If I go to Checkout page and enter the code manually, then I am directly checked-out without this screen.
ok my bad. I didn;t update the new version for download. Give me two minutes
@veris-nayan - Oh okay!
@itly Check now. https://www.veris.in/hackerone-sandbox-apps-download/
Now give me the same screenshot from this app.
@veris-nayan - Link is down I suppose.
Its Working
@veris-nayan - Please find it attached.

With the XSS script :|

Input the string in additional comments and see what comes here. 
That will validate your input. We already have the screenshot of the Veris View.

Sorry for being demanding on this issue but I had specifically fixed this on Visitor Logs. So if its still happening, I want to be sure about the case generated.
@veris-nayan - New entries are not visible in visitor's log.
Its ok. I got your point and I will validate at my end. If it validates, I would triage and start working on the same.

@veris-nayan - Alright. But I would just like to request that if the new version of app validates it properly, then please don't close report. Instead triage and then mark as resolved as you never shared the updated app and for the same reason, I don't want to loose my signal on hackerone. Hope you'll understand.
I get it. :)
We have released the update to fix the issue. Please validate at your end. Thanks for your help.
@veris-nayan - The fix has been validated. Issue is patched. :)
Thanks for your help. Veris feels more secured now.
@itly , Please accept this Certificate of Appreciation as a token of our gratitude.
